ygData.messageBody:
Since we have the ability to locate, there is some precedent for a Summon
Corpse equivalent, although I think Verant want to keep that as Necro-only.

So a similar song that is useless enough for us to actually get:

A song that summons the bard to the targeted corpse - a cross between
Lyssa's Locating Lyric and Melanie's Mellifluous Motion. Quit laughing and
hear me out. First you would target the live player and use Lyssa's
Locating Lyric to target his corpse regardless of where it is in the zone.
Then you would play this song and summon yourself (*squisha*) to that
corpse. The catch is that this song would be only a trinket though unless
Verant added the feature that this *one song* did not cancel Invis or Invis
vs. Undead. This would give us a similar ability to Necros with much more
danger to the bard (Verant would like that), plus it would be useless in
some high level dungeons and the Planes where everything can see you
regardless. This, therefore, would not lessen the need for a Necro in those
really sticky situations like Planes and Dragon corpse retrievals.

[46 Bard] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: work

> Nah - it's gotta be Bardic (and with those undead Bards in Paineel, this
> would be perfect ;)
> "Talies' Dance of the Dead - targetted corpse, if within range
> (limited to
> about 100 feet or so, of course) gets up and walks to it's owner (Owner
> must be within "heal" range of the Bard)"
>
> This would be great for lava and "stuck in the wall" retrievals,
> but not as
> powerful as the Necro summoning. Additionally, Necros could get this as a
> spell at a lower level, giving them a little more power, too.
>
> Just a thought...
>
> Talies the Wanna-be-a-Necro
